intro: Dorstenia tanneriana, commonly known as the Tanner's false banana, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, spirally arranged leaves that resemble the leaves of the banana plant. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish or yellowish in color. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its distinctive foliage and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions. Dorstenia tanneriana is also valued for its role in traditional medicine in some regions.
